Description: This interdisciplinary session will convene researchers working at the forefront of cancer biology and metabolism and explore how metabolic processes, from organelles to entire organisms, influence cancer development and progression. Experts will dissect metabolic reprogramming in cancer cells, investigating the roles of various cellular components like mitochondria, lysosomes and autophagy. Discussions will encompass systemic metabolic influences on tumorigenesis, aiming to uncover potential therapeutic avenues. By fostering collaborative discussions and sharing diverse insights, this symposium serves as a platform to deepen our comprehension of the complexities of cancer metabolism. It aspires to inspire innovative research directions and approaches, ultimately contributing to advancements in our ability to tackle this formidable disease.
Location: Ballroom 6 B - Upper Level - Convention Center
SearchResultBody: SY35. Cancer Metabolism Across Scales: From Organelles to Organisms

Title: Cancer Metabolism Across Scales: From Organelles to Organisms
